name: IZERVAY
indications: IZERVAY™ is indicated for the treatment of geographic atrophy (GA) secondary to age-related macular degeneration (AMD).
contraindications: The recommended dose for IZERVAY is 2 mg (0.1 mL of 20 mg/mL solution) administered by intravitreal injection to each affected eye once monthly (approximately 28 ± 7 days) ( 2.2 ).
warningsAndPrecautions: IZERVAY (avacincaptad pegol intravitreal solution) is supplied as a sterile, clear to slightly opalescent, colorless to slightly yellowish 20 mg/mL solution in a single-dose glass vial. Each glass vial contains an overfill amount to allow administration of a single 0.1 mL dose of solution containing 2 mg of avacincaptad pegol (oligonucleotide basis). Each IZERVAY carton (NDC 82829-002-01) contains one glass vial, one sterile 5-micron transfer filter needle (18-gauge x 1½ inch, 1.2 mm x 40 mm), and one sterile 1 mL Luer lock syringe.
adverseReactions: • Ocular or periocular infections ( 4.1 ). • Active intraocular inflammation ( 4.2 ).
